_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:21:58 using v2.1
title: What are the differences between acute and non-acute care in the number of patients affected by delayed transfer of care?
analysis_commentary: The overall number of patients experiencing a delayed transfer of care appears to have decreased over time. However, this appears to be mainly driven by improvements in the number of patients being effectively discharged from non-acute care. The numbers of people delayed in acute hospitals has been rising.
data_source: NHS England, Delayed transfer of care
